title: Requires warning labels on certain foods which present a choking hazard to children under four years of age
summary: Requires warning labels on popcorn, chewing gum, hard candies, raisins, peanut butter, nuts or seeds which present a choking hazard to children under four years of age; and provides civil penalties for violations.

       AN ACT to amend the agriculture and markets law, in relation to  requir-
         ing  warning labels on certain foods which present a choking hazard to
         children under four years of age

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1. The agriculture and markets law is amended by adding a new
    2  section 214-o to read as follows:
    3    S 214-O. WARNING LABELS ON CERTAIN FOOD PRODUCTS. 1.  IF  ANY  PERSON,
    4  FIRM,  CORPORATION, PARTNERSHIP, ASSOCIATION OR ANY OTHER BUSINESS ASSO-
    5  CIATION SELLS OR DISPLAYS FOR RETAIL SALE  POPCORN,  CHEWING  GUM,  HARD
    6  CANDIES,  RAISINS,  PEANUT  BUTTER, NUTS OR SEEDS MEANT FOR USE AS HUMAN
    7  FOOD, THE  PACKAGING  OF  SUCH  FOOD  SHALL  BEAR  A  WARNING  LABEL  AS
    8  PRESCRIBED  IN  THIS  SECTION WHICH SHALL BE PRINTED THEREON OR ATTACHED
    9  THERETO. SUCH WARNING LABEL SHALL BE IN  LETTERS  NOT  LESS  THAN  EIGHT
   10  POINT  TYPE  AND  IN A COLOR IN CONTRAST WITH THE PACKAGE CONTAINING THE
   11  SUPPLEMENT, AND SHALL CONTAIN THE FOLLOWING  STATEMENT:  "WARNING:  THIS
   12  PRODUCT IS A CHOKING HAZARD TO CHILDREN UNDER FOUR YEARS OF AGE."
   13    2.  ANY  PERSON,  FIRM,  CORPORATION OR ASSOCIATION OR ITS OFFICERS OR
   14  AGENTS WHO OR WHICH VIOLATE ANY OF THE PROVISIONS OF THIS SECTION OR ANY
   15  RULES OR REGULATIONS PROMULGATED UNDER THIS SECTION SHALL BE LIABLE  FOR
   16  A  CIVIL  PENALTY OF NOT MORE THAN ONE HUNDRED DOLLARS FOR EACH DAY SUCH
   17  ENTITY IS IN VIOLATION OF THIS SECTION.
   18    3. THE COMMISSIONER SHALL HAVE THE AUTHORITY AND POWER TO PRESCRIBE BY
   19  REGULATIONS THE LABELING OF THE FOOD PRODUCTS IN SUBDIVISION ONE OF THIS
   20  SECTION WHICH ARE NOT SOLD BY PACKAGE OR CONTAINER.
   21    S 2. This act shall take effect on the one hundred twentieth day after
   22  it shall have become a law. Effective immediately  the  commissioner  of
   23  agriculture  and  markets  is  authorized and directed to promulgate any
   24  rules or regulations necessary for the timely implementation of this act
   25  before such effective date.

memo:
BILL NUMBER:S2132

TITLE OF BILL:

An act
to amend the agriculture and markets law, in relation to requiring
warning labels on certain foods which present a choking hazard to
children under four years of age

PURPOSE:

This bill requires warning labels on certain foods which present a
choking hazard to children under four years of age.

SUMMARY OF PROVISIONS:

Section 1 amends the agriculture and markets law by adding a new
section 214-o. Any business which sells or displays for retail sale
popcorn, chewing gum, hard candies, raisins, peanut butter, nuts or
seeds shall bear warning labels on packaging. This label shall be in
letters not smaller than eight point type and in a color in contrast
with the packaging. The statement shall read: "WARNING: This product
is a choking hazard to children under four years of age."

Any person or corporation in violation shall be liable of a civil
penalty of not more than one hundred dollars for each day of violation.

The commissioner shall have the power to prescribe the labeling
regulations.

Section 2 implements this measure on the one hundred twentieth day
after it shall become law.

JUSTIFICATION:

This measure is intended to increase public awareness of the hazards
that some foods may present to children under four years of age.
Common choking foods enumerated in this legislation are identified by
the American Academy of Pediatrics as being dangerous to children
under age four. According to Academy estimates in 2001, 17,500
children were treated in emergency rooms for choking.

In August of 2004, a 3-year old Queens boy choked to death on popcorn
at a local movie theater. This bill seeks to prevent further tragedy.

LEGISLATIVE HISTORY:

New bill.

EFFECTIVE DATE:

This act shall take effect on the one hundred twentieth day after it
shall become law.
